KANAL:
We performed an initial evaluation of KANAL (a tool for helping users build/check process models) in December 2000, which has been reported in Kim and Gil, IJCAI-01. The results show that KANAL can find most of the errors in the process models and suggest useful fixes including the fixes that directly point to the sources of the errors.
KANAL has been successfully integrated within the end-to-end system (SHAKEN) that supports subject matter experts entering domain knowledge. During summer 2001, the SHAKEN system has been evaluated by lightly trained biologists where they author biology textbook knowledge using the system. The resulting knowledge bases answer questions that a student might be asked based on the chapter's contents.
Dialog Manager: initial sketch is now available.
Expression Composer: initial sketch is now available.
SADL: Its design is reported in Feb 2001. Currently, KANAL can support most of the functions.

description.short: We are participating in the DARPA Rapid Knowledge Formation (RKF) program. As a part of the program we are working on several research thrusts (1) KANAL: building/checking process models (2) Dialog Manager: keeping track of user actions and making suggestions (3) Expression Composer: helping users to express their knowledge without worrying about underlying representation language (4) SADL: a language to describe process models.
description.long:
We are participating in the DARPA Rapid Knowledge Formation (RKF) program where the goal is to enable distributed teams of subject matter experts (SMEs) to enter and modify knowledge directly and easily, without training in knowledge representation, acquisition, or manipulation.
As a part of the program, we are working on several research thrusts.
KANAL (building/checking process models): We have built a tool for building and checking process models. By relating different pieces of information in process models among themselves and to the existing KB, it performs a variety of verification and validation checks and propose useful fixes. Our initial evaluation of KANAL a stand-alone system shows its usefulness in finding errors and suggesting fixes. It also has been successfully integrated within an end-to-end system that support users entering domain knowledge
Dialog Manager (keeping track of user actions and making suggestions): We are developing a dialogue manager that uses KA plans to keep track of the user's actions and can make suggestions for how to proceed. The dialogue manager would support: 1) generation, to suggest to the user what to do next based on the library of KA plans, 2) recognition, to track what the user is doing in terms of the KA plans. The dialogue state would be shown to the user as a "status" window, where the user could see the currently active KA plans as a list of bullets and sub-bullets, each bullet would be checked if completed and collapsed when all its sub-bullets are completed.
Expression Composer (helping users to express their knowledge without worrying about the underlying representation language): The English editor allows the user to examine and modify problem-solving knowledge through an automatically-generated English paraphrase of that knowledge. When users select parts of the paraphrase to modify, the editor suggests replacements, also paraphrased. The editor can also compose expressions based on search terms from the user.
SADL (a language to describe process models): We have developed the SHAKEN action language, for representing processes with loops, partially ordered events and conditional and disjunctive events in KM.
KANAL has been successfully integrated within an end-to-end system ( SHAKEN) and other two are being developed as modules within the next version of the system.
